page.title: 18Legacy of the Romans
page.content: In the northwest corner of the block, near Kenchester, is the site of the Roman town of Magnis, still evidenced in the name of the adjoining Magna Castra farm. The site was excavated many years ago and the artefacts are lodged in the Hereford City Museum. The site is now under grass but the outline of the walls is still visible. Roman roads crossed here, one running east/west and another north to the Roman town of Viriconium and south to Abergavenny. Part of the course of the latter lies in the southwest of the block.Several existing roads in the block follow the lines of these Roman roads.
